metadata.case_name: Co-operative Society v. Commissioner of Income-tax

facts.text: The appellant is a Society registered under the Co-operative Societies Act, 1912.

Data relating to the earnings, investments, working capital, outgoings and expenditure of the Society for the year ending June 30, 1955, relevant to the assessment year 1956-57: Interest from Government securities Rs. 4,30,453.00; Total gross earnings Rs. 21,00,994.00; Investments in Government securities Rs. 130,60,653.00; Total working capital Rs. 473,42,603.00; Interest paid on debentures, deposits and other accounts Rs. 15,09,490.00; Total overhead expenses and establishment overhead charges Rs. 3,01,102.00.

In proceeding for assessment of total income for AY 1956-57, Society claimed exemption under s.14(3) of Indian Income-tax Act, 1922 (added by s.10 Finance Act 1955 w.e.f. April 1, 1955) for income from business; out of gross income from securities Rs.4,30,453, only Rs.13,578 chargeable to tax per instructions under s.60, relying on Income-tax Manual 1946.

Income-tax Officer held Society could not claim benefit of Departmental Instructions as they ceased to operate; applied Explanation to s.8 (incorporated by Finance Act 1956 w.e.f. April 1, 1956); computed taxable income under interest on securities as Rs.59,498.

Appellate Assistant Commissioner modified ITO order, reduced taxable income to Rs.13,578 applying Departmental Instructions; held Explanation to s.8 applies to Banking Companies not Co-operative Societies.
Appellate Tribunal reversed AAC, restored ITO order; Explanation to s.8 not applicable as Society not Banking Company, but principle of Explanation applicable; relief of Rs.59,498 only entitled.
Tribunal submitted question to High Court of Madras: Whether Tribunal justified in holding taxable income from interest on securities Rs.59,498?
High Court reframed question: Whether taxable income from interest on securities Rs.13,578 as contended by assessee on basis of Departmental instructions?; answered in favour of Commissioner.

Departmental Instructions issued under s.60: notification August 25, 1925 modified June 25, 1927, October 20, 1934, August 18, 1945; exempted profits of Co-operative Society excluding income from securities under s.8.
Finance Act 1955 s.10 added s.14(3) w.e.f. April 1, 1955 exempting tax on profits/gains of business of Co-operative Society.
Finance Act 1956 amended s.8 adding Explanation for Banking Companies for computation of expenses and interest on borrowings proportionate to gross receipts from securities vs all sources.
Departmental notification withdrawn before relevant assessment year.
It is admitted that Rs.13,578 is the gross income from securities liable to tax according to the rule of proportion of capital used for business to total working capital.

legal_issues.text: Whether the taxable income of the assessee from interest on securities is Rs. 59,498 as held by ITO/Tribunal or Rs. 13,578 as per Departmental instructions/proportion of working capital.

petitioner_arguments.text: Income from business exempt under s.14(3); only Rs.13,578 out of securities income chargeable per s.60 instructions in Income-tax Manual 1946.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.14(3) Indian Income-tax Act 1922; s.60 instructions

petitioner_arguments.text: No part of income from Government securities taxable, relying on Commissioner of Income-tax, Andhra Pradesh v. Cocanada Radhaswami Bank Ltd.

respondent_arguments.text: Departmental Instructions ceased; apply Explanation to s.8 principle even if not banking company; taxable Rs.59,498.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Explanation to s.8 Indian Income-tax Act 1922

court_reasoning.text: COCANADA case distinguished, not under s.14(3); cannot contend Rs.13,578 itself not taxable as not raised before Tribunal.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Society cannot raise new contention that entire securities income exempt.

court_reasoning.text: Departmental instructions withdrawn; Explanation to s.8 not applicable to non-banking co-op society; common ground no statutory rule or instructions for apportionment.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Cannot tax entire income as it would infringe s.14(3).

court_reasoning.text: Evolve rule consistent with commercial accounting: proportion of income from securities exempt under s.14(3) is proportion which capital used for business bears to total working capital.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Explanation to s.8 is for allocating outgoings in banking companies, not for apportioning composite income partly taxable/partly exempt.

court_reasoning.text: Rs.13,578 admitted as taxable per this rule; no question on deductions for collection expenses.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Rule dismembers income in proportion to business and non-business components.

holdings.text: Taxable income from interest on securities under s.8 is Rs.13,578, computed as proportion of working capital used in business to total working capital.

precedents_cited.case_name: Commissioner of Income-tax, Andhra Pradesh v. Cocanada Radhaswami Bank Ltd.
precedents_cited.relevance: Relates to carry forward of losses by banking company against securities as trading assets, not under s.14(3).

statutes_cited.name: Indian Income-tax Act, 1922
statutes_cited.relevance: s.14(3) exempts business profits of co-op society; s.8 taxes interest on securities with apportionment needed; Explanation for banking cos allocation of expenses/interest.

statutes_cited.name: Finance Act, 1955
statutes_cited.relevance: Added s.14(3) w.e.f. April 1, 1955 exempting co-op society business profits.

statutes_cited.name: Finance Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Added Explanation to s.8 for banking companies.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; answer to High Court question: taxable income from securities Rs.13,578.
outcome.relief_granted: Taxable income from interest on securities held at Rs.13,578.

key_quotes.text: "The proportion of income from securities which is exempt from taxation under s.14(3) of the Act will be that proportion which the capital of the Society used for the purpose of the business bears to the total working capital."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Evolves the rule for apportionment adopted by court.

key_quotes.text: "It was never urged, and it cannot be urged, that in the absence of a specific rule for apportionment, the entire income from Government securities should be brought to tax."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects taxing entire income due to s.14(3).
